subject: Sales
title: The Agora: Sales in Ancient Greece
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Agora: Sales in Ancient Greece usable.

hook.text: In Athens, the agora was more than a market. It was where democracy, philosophy, and selling met.

buildup.text: Greek merchants perfected visual display, arranging goods by color and position to attract buyers.

discovery.text: Aristotle named three persuasion modes: ethos, pathos, logos. Sellers have relied on them ever since.

punchline.text: The Greeks sold goods and invented persuasion theory.

quiz.question: What did Aristotle contribute to the theory of selling?
options: Three modes of persuasion: ethos, pathos, logos
